revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=June 2013}} {{Infobox person | name = Aisha Tyler | image = Aisha Tyler SDCC 2014.jpg | image_size = | caption = Tyler at [[San Diego Comic-Con International]] in 2013 | birth_name = Aisha N. Tyler | birth_date = {{birth date and age|mf=yes|1970|9|18}} | birth_place = [[San Francisco]], [[California]], US | alma_mater = [[Dartmouth College]] (1992) | occupation = Talk show host, actress, comedian, author, producer, writer, director | spouse = Jeff Tietjens
(m. 1992; div. 2017) | years_active = 1996–present | website = {{url|http://www.aishatyler.com}} }} '''Aisha N. Tyler''' (born September 18, 1970) is an American actress and comedian. She is known for portraying Andrea Marino in the first season of ''[[Ghost Whisperer]]'', voicing [[Lana Anthony Kane|Lana Kane]] in ''[[Archer (TV series)|Archer]]'', portraying Dr. Tara Lewis in ''[[Criminal Minds]]'' and portraying Mother Nature in the [[The Santa Clause (film series)|''Santa Clause'' film series]], as well as recurring roles in ''[[CSI: Crime Scene Investigation]]'', ''[[Talk Soup]]'' and ''[[Friends]]''. She is a former co-host of CBS's ''[[The Talk (U.S. TV series)|The Talk]]'',{{cite web| first= Gina | last= Serpe|url = http://www.eonline.com/news/from_talk_soup_talk_aisha_tyler_makes/271160|title = From Talk Soup to The Talk: Aisha Tyler Makes Her Morning-Show Debut!|publisher = [[E! News]]|date = October 24, 2011|accessdate = 2012-01-01}} and the host of ''[[Whose Line Is It Anyway? (U.S. TV series)|Whose Line Is It Anyway?]]'' Tyler also hosted [[Ubisoft]]'s [[Electronic Entertainment Expo|E3]] press conferences from 2012 to 2016, and has made various video game appearances including ''[[Halo: Reach]]'' and Ubisoft's ''[[Watch Dogs]]'' where her voice and likeness are featured. ==Early life== Tyler was born in San Francisco, California, the daughter of Robin Gregory, a teacher, and James Tyler, a photographer.{{cite web | title=Aisha Tyler (1970- ) | url=http://www.filmreference.com/film/35/Aisha-Tyler.html | website=Film.Reference.com | accessdate=July 28, 2008|archivedate= February 28, 2017| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20170228194250/http://www.filmreference.com/film/35/Aisha-Tyler.html|deadurl=no}} The family spent one year in [[Ethiopia]] and later spent time living in an [[ashram]] in the US. She pursued an early interest in comedy at [[McAteer High School]] in San Francisco, which had a special program called School of the Arts, now named [[Ruth Asawa San Francisco School of the Arts]].{{cite web | title=Adam Carolla Podcast | url=https://archive.org/details/2009.03.10acp-Tyler | date=March 9, 2009 | accessdate=April 13, 2008}} Tyler attended high school with [[Sam Rockwell]], and [[Margaret Cho]]. She had a crush on Rockwell, and followed him into acting class one day, leading to her interest in improv and sketch.{{cite web|title=In Bed With Joan - Episode 18: Aisha Tyler|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W4oqc8OdppY|website=YouTube|accessdate=23 September 2015}} Tyler graduated from [[Dartmouth College]] in 1992.{{cite web|url=http://www.cbswatchmagazine.com/2013/05/talk-the-talk/ |title=Talk the Talk |work=CBS Watch! |accessdate=April 15, 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160427031901/http://www.cbswatchmagazine.com/2013/05/talk-the-talk/ |archivedate=April 27, 2016 }}{{cite web|url=http://now.dartmouth.edu/2013/07/aisha-tyler-92-power-mistakes-forbes|title=Aisha Tyler ’92 on the Power of Mistakes (Forbes)|publisher= Dartmouth College| website= dartmouth.edu|accessdate=April 15, 2016|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160425225313/http://now.dartmouth.edu/2013/07/aisha-tyler-92-power-mistakes-forbes|archivedate=April 25, 2016|df=mdy-all}} She was a member of [[The Tabard (fraternity)|The Tabard]], a co-ed fraternity.{{cite web|url=http://www.msn.com/en-us/entertainment/gallery/celebs-in-the-ivy-league/ss-AA8guno#image=26|title=Celebs in the Ivy League|website= msn.com|access-date=2017-03-24}} At Dartmouth, she co-founded and sang in the [[Dartmouth College student groups#Dartmouth Rockapellas|Dartmouth Rockapellas]], an all-female [[a cappella]] group devoted to spreading social awareness through song. After briefly working for a San Francisco advertising firm, she toured the country pursuing a comedy career before moving to Los Angeles in 1996.{{Citation needed|date=April 2016}} ==Career== {{BLP sources section|date=September 2015}} [[File:AishaTyler01.JPG|thumb|left|Tyler signing at a [[Barnes & Noble]] bookstore in New York]] Tyler's career in television took off in 2001 with jobs as the host of ''[[Talk Soup]]'' and the reality-dating series ''[[The Fifth Wheel]]'', although ''Talk Soup'' was canceled the following year and Tyler left ''The Fifth Wheel'' in 2002 to pursue other interests. Tyler has devoted a significant amount of her time to independent projects, including a role in the play ''Moose Mating'', for which she received an [[NAACP Image Award]]. She also wrote, directed, and starred in the independent short film ''The Whipper''. Moving into acting, Tyler featured in ''[[Friends]]'' as Dr. Charlie Wheeler, [[Joey Tribbiani|Joey]]'s and then [[Ross Geller|Ross]]' girlfriend, in the ninth and tenth seasons. She followed this up with guest spots on ''[[CSI: Miami]]'' and ''[[Nip/Tuck]]'', as well as balancing season-long recurring roles on both ''[[CSI: Crime Scene Investigation]]'' and ''[[24 (television)|24]]'' during the 2004–2005 television season. She also filmed her own sitcom pilot for CBS, which was not picked up. She has guest-starred on ''[[MADtv]]''. Following her regular role on the CBS series ''[[Ghost Whisperer]]'' during its first season, Tyler appeared in several films, including ''[[The Santa Clause 2]]'', ''[[The Santa Clause 3: The Escape Clause]]'', ''[[.45 (film)|.45]]'', and the comedy ''[[Balls of Fury]]''. In 2007, she filmed the thriller ''[[Death Sentence (2007 film)|Death Sentence]]'' and the crime drama ''[[Black Water Transit]]''. She also continues to appear on television, with appearances on ''[[Boston Legal]]'', ''[[Reno 911!]]'', ''[[The Boondocks (TV series)|The Boondocks]]'', and as a guest film critic on several episodes of ''[[At the Movies with Ebert & Roeper]]'', filling in for the absent [[Roger Ebert]] while he recuperated from surgery. [[File:The Ladies of TV 2012.jpg|thumb|''The Talk'' co-hosts [[Julie Chen]], Aisha Tyler, [[Sharon Osbourne]], [[Sara Gilbert]], and [[Sheryl Underwood]] in 2012]] Tyler has moved into print media as a regular contributor to ''[[Glamour (magazine)|Glamour]]'', ''[[Jane (magazine)|Jane]]'', and ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' magazines. Her first book, ''Swerve: A Guide to the Sweet Life for Postmodern Girls'', was released in January 2004.{{cite book|last=Tyler|first=Aisha|title=Swerve: A Guide to the Sweet Life for Postmodern Girls|location=New York|publisher=Plume|year=2004|isbn=0-525-94806-6}} Tyler plays on the ''[[World Poker Tour]]'' in the Hollywood Home games for the [[Futures Without Violence]] charity. She also made a guest appearance on [[Kanye West]]'s single "[[Slow Jamz]]", which featured [[Twista]] and [[Jamie Foxx]]. Philanthropy and charity work are very important to Tyler, and she regularly does volunteer work for the [[American Red Cross]], [[The Trust for Public Land]], [[Planned Parenthood Federation of America]], and the [[International Rescue Committee]]. Tyler appeared in a nude pictorial, along with other celebrities, in the May 2006 issue of ''[[Allure (magazine)|Allure]]''.{{cite web |title=Stars Line Up For Naked Spread |url=http://www.contactmusic.com/carla-gugino/news/stars-line-up-for-naked-spread_1028957 |publisher=Contactmusic.com |date=April 24, 2007 |access-date=July 29, 2008 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080731202413/http://www.contactmusic.com/news.nsf/article/stars%20line%20up%20for%20naked%20spread_1028957 |archive-date=July 31, 2008 |dead-url=no}} The annual Nude Issue raises money to combat [[skin cancer]]. In May 2009, it was announced that ABC had given Tyler her own talk show pilot, ''The Aisha Tyler Show''.{{cite web|url = http://www.tvguide.com/News/Aisha-Tyler-Talk-1005895.aspx|title = Aisha Tyler Nabs Talk Show Pilot|publisher = TVGuide.com|accessdate = May 8, 2009|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20090520111614/http://www.tvguide.com/News/Aisha-Tyler-Talk-1005895.aspx|archivedate = May 20, 2009|deadurl = no|date = May 8, 2009|last = Joyce Eng}} In early May 2010, she presented the "Welcome to the Beta" video for ''[[Halo: Reach]]''. She also voiced a minor character in the game.[https://twitter.com/aishatyler/status/9559941260 Off to voice a character in Halo:Reach tomorrow. Dreams really do come true], twitter.com, February 24, 2010. In 2009, she began her starring role voicing Lana Kane in the [[FX (TV channel)|FX]] series ''[[Archer (TV series)|Archer]]'', which premiered on January 14, 2010{{cite web|last=Eng |first=Joyce |url=http://www.tvguide.com/news/fx-sets-midseason-1012661/ |title=FX Sets Midseason Schedule - Today's News: Our Take |publisher=TVGuide.com |date=2009-12-01 |accessdate=2017-08-07}} and has been renewed for a sixth and seventh season, to premiere through 2016.{{cite web|last=Molloy |first=Tim |url=http://www.thewrap.com/fxs-archer-renewed-2-seasons/ |title=FX's 'Archer' Renewed for 2 More Seasons |publisher=Thewrap.com |date= |accessdate=2017-08-07}} In August 2010, Tyler began appearing in a recurring guest spot on ''[[The Stephanie Miller Show]]''. The segment is named "Tuesdays With Tyler".stephaniemiller.com Tyler appears either in-studio or via phone when she is not otherwise committed to one of her acting roles. While [[Hal Sparks]] was out of the country, Tyler filled in as the third member of the Stephanie Miller Sexy Liberal Comedy Tour on three shows in August 2011.{{cite web|url = http://www.sexyliberal.com/2011/06/08/detroit-mi-082011-detroit-opera-house-sexy-liberal-show-with-stephanie-miller-john-fuglesang-and-aisha-tyler|title = Stephanie Miller Sexy Liberal Comedy Tour|date = June 8, 2011|accessdate = September 21, 2015|website = sexyliberal.com|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20110627004724/http://www.sexyliberal.com/2011/06/08/detroit-mi-082011-detroit-opera-house-sexy-liberal-show-with-stephanie-miller-john-fuglesang-and-aisha-tyler/|archivedate = June 27, 2011}} Also in 2009, Tyler performed her stand-up comedy routine, live at the [[Fillmore Theatre]].https://m.imdb.com/title/tt1361808/ Starting on July 26, 2011, Tyler started her own weekly podcast, ''[[Girl on Guy]]'', where she interviews her favorite celebrity friends and discusses topics guys love. ''Girl on Guy'' is available on her website for download using [[iTunes]], mp3, and [[RSS]]. The show launched as the No. 4 comedy podcast on [[iTunes]] and currently is the No. 2 comedy podcast, and the No. 7 overall podcast on iTunes. The first weekly installment of ''Girl on Guy'' featured guest [[H. Jon Benjamin]], the second featured the host of [[Current TV]]'s former show ''[[InfoMania]]'' [[Brett Erlich]] on August 1, 2011, and the third featured ''Archer'' creator [[Adam Reed]] on August 9, 2011. In October 2011, it was announced that Tyler would join the cast of ''[[The Talk (U.S. TV series)|The Talk]]'' as a permanent co-host, replacing [[Holly Robinson Peete]]. Her first full week as a co-host was October 24 through October 28, 2011. Tyler is known for being expressive and outspoken on The Talk, especially about [[African American]] culture and stereotypes, [[LGBT]] rights, and [[women's rights]]. Tyler presented [[Ubisoft]]'s press conference at [[Electronic Entertainment Expo|E3]] [[Electronic Entertainment Expo 2012|2012]] in June, which received some backlash from fans who didn't believe Tyler was a gamer.{{cite news|title = Aisha Tyler Rants "I've Been a Gamer Since Before You Could Read."|url = http://kotaku.com/5918084/aisha-tyler-rants-ive-been-a-gamer-since-before-you-could-read|accessdate = September 19, 2013|newspaper = kotaku.com|date = June 13, 2012|last = Evan Narcisse}} This caused Tyler to respond with a poem about how she has been playing video games "since you were a twinge in the left side of your daddy's underoos".{{cite web|title = Dear Gamers:|url = https://www.facebook.com/notes/aisha-tyler/dear-gamers/10151040991508993|work = facebook.com|accessdate = 19 September 2013|date = June 12, 2012}} She returned to host the publisher's press conference [[Electronic Entertainment Expo 2013|the following year]]. Tyler's second book, ''Self-Inflicted Wounds: Heartwarming Tales of Epic Humiliation'', debuted in July 2013, later becoming a ''[[The New York Times Bestseller List|New York Times]]'' bestseller; it was inspired by questions asked of guests on ''Girl on Guy''. In March 2013, Tyler was confirmed to be the new host of the American version of ''[[Whose Line Is It Anyway? (U.S. TV series)|Whose Line Is It Anyway?]]''.{{cite news|title = His line: Improv master Ryan Stiles returns to the PAC|url = http://www.wenatcheeworld.com/news/2013/feb/28/his-line-improv-master-ryan-stiles-returns-to-the/|accessdate = September 19, 2013|newspaper = wenatcheeworld.com|date = February 28, 2013|last = Rachel Hansen}}{{subscription required}} She also appears briefly as herself in the video game ''[[Watch Dogs]]'' and is featured in the music video for the [["Weird Al" Yankovic]] song "[[Tacky (song)|Tacky]]". Tyler was also the original voice for the character [[List of characters in the BioShock series#Daisy Fitzroy|Daisy Fitzroy]] in the 2013 video game ''[[BioShock Infinite]]'', but her recordings were not used{{Cite tweet |user=aishatyler |number=324534447804399617 |date = 17 April 2013 |title=@Vinci_022 you're right! I recorded that role, but just found out they didn't use my recording. there's 47 minutes I'll never get back. }} and the role went to [[Kimberly Brooks]]. She was nominated for Personality of 2014 in [[Golden Joystick Award|Golden Joystick Award 2014]]. In June 2015, it was announced that Tyler landed a recurring role on the eleventh season of ''[[Criminal Minds]]''. Although she served as a temporary replacement for [[Jennifer Love Hewitt]], who was on maternity leave,{{cite web|url = http://www.inquisitr.com/2193773/criminal-minds-season-11-aisha-tyler-recurring-as-best-replacement-for-kate/|title = 'Criminal Minds' Season 11: Aisha Tyler will recur as Hotch looks to replace Kate|date = June 22, 2015|accessdate = September 21, 2015|website = inquisitr.com|last = Meredith Jacobs}} her status was elevated to main cast member in season 12. In 2016, Tyler started a [[Kickstarter]] campaign to fund her directorial feature film debut, ''[[Axis (film)|Axis]]''.[https://variety.com/2016/film/news/aisha-tyler-directing-debut-kickstarter-axis-1201752057/ "Aisha Tyler to make feature directing debut on Kiickstarter-funded Axis."] "Variety", Retrieved January 16, 2017. The film was shot over seven days in May 2016.{{cite web | url = https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/d3wq7k/axis-director-aisha-tyler-is-proving-hollywood-doesnt-know-its-audience | title = 'Axis' Director Aisha Tyler Is Proving Hollywood Doesn't Know Its Audience | date = 6 March 2018 | accessdate = 24 April 2018 | publisher = ''VICE'' | author = Candice Frederick }}{{cite web | url = http://deadline.com/2018/01/aisha-tyler-axis-sundance-video-interview-1202266730/ | title = Aisha Tyler Shot 65 Pages A Day For Ambitious Directorial Debut, ‘Axis’ — Sundance Studio | date = 25 January 2018 | accessdate = 24 April 2018 | publisher = ''Deadline'' | author = Matt Grobar }} ''Axis'' was released via [[video-on-demand]] on April 10, 2018.{{cite web|url=http://www.talkhouse.com/aisha-tylers-guide-to-recovering-from-disaster/|title=Aisha Tyler’s Guide to Recovering From Disaster|last=Tyler|first=Aisha|work="Talkhouse"|date=April 10, 2018|accessdate=April 11, 2018}} On the June 15, 2017, episode of ''[[The Talk (TV series)|The Talk]]'', Tyler announced that she would be leaving the show at the end of the seventh season due to her busy schedule with three other television shows and directing films. She said she would return as a guest host and to promote her various projects.{{cite web|author=Maureen Lee Lenker |url=http://ew.com/tv/2017/06/15/aisha-tyler-leaving-talk/ |title=Aisha Tyler leaving The Talk |publisher=Ew.com |date=2017-06-15 |accessdate=2017-08-07}}{{cite web|author=Hilary Lewis |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/aisha-tyler-leaving-cbs-talk-1013879 |title=Aisha Tyler Leaving CBS' 'The Talk' |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |date=2017-06-15 |accessdate=2017-08-07}} == Personal life == Tyler married attorney Jeff Tietjens in 1992{{cite news|url=http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/aisha-tyler-husband-jeff-tietjens-to-divorce-after-20-years-of-marriage-w202869|title=Aisha Tyler, Husband Jeff Tietjens to Divorce After More Than 20 Years of Marriage| first= Esther |last=Lee | work=[[Us Weekly]]| date= April 15, 2016|accessdate=June 15, 2017}} or 1994{{cite web|url= http://www.etonline.com/news/186966_aisha_tyler_opens_up_about_divorce_after_20_years_of_marriage/ |title= Aisha Tyler Opens Up About Divorce After 20 Years of Marriage: 'I'll Always Love Him'| work=[[Entertainment Tonight]] | first=John|last= Boone |date=April 18, 2016|accessdate=June 15, 2017}} (sources differ). The pair separated in January 2015 and Tietjens filed for divorce in April 2016.{{cite news|title=''The Talk''{{'}}s Aisha Tyler and Husband Divorcing After More Than 20 Years of Marriage |url=http://www.people.com/article/aisha-tyler-jeff-tietjens-divorcing |accessdate=April 15, 2016 |work=[[People (magazine)|People]] |agency=[[Time Inc.]] |date=April 15, 2016 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6gnbVEF1z?url=http://www.people.com/article/aisha-tyler-jeff-tietjens-divorcing |archivedate=April 16, 2016 |location=United States |deadurl=no |df=mdy }} It was finalized in May 2017.{{cite web|url= http://www.tmz.com/2017/05/18/aisha-tyler-divorce-pay-ex-husband-two-million/|title=Aisha Tyler Ordered to Pay Ex Husband $2 Million in Divorce| publisher=[[TMZ.com]]| date=May 18, 2017|accessdate=June 15, 2017}} Tyler stated about 1hr and 5 minutes into the April 16, 2018 episode of [[WTF with Marc Maron]] that she was married for 25 years.http://www.wtfpod.com/podcast/episode-907-aisha-tyler-louie-anderson Tyler is a vocal advocate for the rights of the [[LGBTQ]] community.{{cite web|url = http://www.out.com/entertainment/2013/08/01/geeking-out-gay-advocate-aisha-tyler|title = Geeking Out with Aisha Tyler|date = August 1, 2013|accessdate = September 21, 2015|website = out.com|last = Patrick Yacco}} ==Filmography== ===Film=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year ! Title ! Role ! class="unsortable" | Notes |- | 2000 | ''[[Dancing in September]]'' | Woman with Weave | |- | 2001 | ''Moose Mating'' | Josie | |- | 2002 | ''[[The Santa Clause 2]]'' | Mother Nature | |- | 2003 | ''One Flight Stand'' | Alexis | |- | 2004 | ''[[Never Die Alone]]'' | Nancy | |- |rowspan="2" | 2006 | ''[[The Santa Clause 3: The Escape Clause]]'' | Mother Nature | |- | ''[[.45 (film)|.45]]'' | Liz | |- |rowspan="3" | 2007 | ''[[Death Sentence (2007 film)|Death Sentence]]'' | Detective Wallis | |- | ''[[Balls of Fury]]'' | Mahogany | |- | ''The Trap!'' | Angela | |- |rowspan="2" | 2008 | ''[[Meet Market (film)|Meet Market]]'' | Jane | |- | ''[[Bedtime Stories (film)|Bedtime Stories]]'' | Donna Hynde | |- | 2009 |''[[Black Water Transit]]'' | Casey Spandau | |- | 2010 |''[[The Babymakers]]'' | Karen | |- | 2017 |''[[Axis (film)|Axis]]'' | Louise | Voice |- | 2019 | ''[[Friendsgiving (film)|Friendsgiving]]'' | Lauren | Post-production |} ===Television=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year ! Title ! Club |date=May 20, 2013 |accessdate=April 24, 2014 |first=Marah |last=Eakin }}{{cite web|url = http://silversunpickups.com/videos/|title = Simmer (scroll down on page)|publisher = Silversun Pickups|date = May 20, 2013|accessdate = September 21, 2015}} |- | "Crucial Velocity" | [[Clutch (band)|Clutch]] | Director{{cite web|url=http://www.metalinsider.net/video/clutch-got-aisha-tyler-to-direct-a-video |title=Clutch got Aisha Tyler to direct a video |publisher=Metal Insider |date=August 29, 2013 |accessdate=April 24, 2014 |first=Bram |last=Teitelman }} |- | 2014 | "Tacky" | [["Weird Al" Yankovic]] | |- | 2016 | "Gone Cold" | [[Clutch (band)|Clutch]] | |} ===Director=== {| class="wikitable sortable" !
